intro: Ligusticum pyrenaeum proles huteri, commonly known as the Pyrenean lovage, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows to a height of 50–100 cm, featuring finely divided, fern-like leaves and yellowish-white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or forested habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
